name: Collaboration for AIDS Vaccine and Discovery (CAVD) DataSpace
abstract: CAVD DataSpace is a Gates Foundation supported IID repository that includes immune data.
description:
The DataSpace data sharing and discovery tool was created for the HIV vaccine research community to enable and encourage exploration of data beyond the primary analyses, make the community more aware of research being conducted in the field, and facilitate inter-network collaboration among researchers.

DataSpace provides a publicly accessible environment optimized for sharing data and information from HIV vaccine studies and the complex immunogenicity data these studies generate. In DataSpace:

    Datasets for standardized immunogenicity assays are integrated and compiled across studies using a standard data structure and controlled terminology to facilitate meta-analysis. Additional datasets for non-integrated assays and those used for publication analyses are available on the study and publication pages,

    Data processing is performed in coordination with statistical and data management staff to maintain reproducibility of analyses,

    Studies are curated with descriptions and metadata (e.g., summary of study findings, vaccine strategies, treatment schedules and products used, assays performed, and relationships between studies), as well as links to publications and data summary reports to promote well-informed interpretation of the data,

    Datasets are easily accessible using the in-application export feature or the DataSpaceR application programming interface (API),

    Data permissions are defined for each study, and

    Outreach activities promote data use and inform members about new findings and work being done in the field.

The DataSpace application is an integral part of the larger Collaborative DataSpace Program – combining a rich data catalog, engaging user support, and an adjustable security model to fulfill data governance requirements – all in an easy-to-use discovery tool that enables researchers to quickly locate, visualize and export data of interest.

The DataSpace was developed for the Collaboration for AIDS Vaccine and Discovery (CAVD) and is currently implemented as the CAVD DataSpace.

citation.name: Accelerating Innovation: Advancing Opportunities in HIV Vaccine Development.
